column4: err, my friend's x stopped working and dmesg is being outputted to the terminal for some reason, i've recently recompiled a kernel, any idea what could be causing it?
Well, recompiling the kernel will require you to recompile the nvidia kernel modules. Also if you haven't got a system logger all log info is dumped to a terminal.
apparently, a lot of the services failed to start.
Well, then apperantly you did something wrong. ;D
Is there a feature missing in the stock kernel that requires you to customize it?
some frequency scaling, and i had to do a kernel hack to foce native p2 support.

d/l and install the nvidia kernel module from nvidia.com last time I checked. I haven't reconfigured my kernel in Ubuntu as the stock kernel has got all my needs covered and I am happy with the speed of things.
laptop?
yep.
Well, then I can see the need for recompiling the kernel. However I've never put my hands on freqscale as I haven't got a lappy. :)
lol, ssh is failing to start :P
Any sensible error messages?
looks like its outputting ethernet stuff to terminal
o.O
she uninstalled friestarter.... and it stopped o.O;
firestarter stopped when it was uninstalled?? Interesting.
indeed it did, and ssh works again o.O;
as in, it stopped failing.
firestarter being a ehh.. firewall of sorts?
indeed.
Might sound like you missed some entries for iptables in your kernel config then.
happen to know how i fix the nvidia-glx driver, i removed and reinstalled it via synaptic.
Don't remember, sorry.
